|wuu=sy 3tshoe 1 |poj=SÃ¹-chhoan |h=Si-tshÃ´n }} 'Sichuan'
(}}, known formerly in the West by its postal map spellings of 'Szechwan' or
'Szechuan') is a province of the People's Republic of China, located in the
southwest of the country. The current name of the province, "åå·", is an
abbreviation of "åå·è·¯" (SÃ¬ ChuÄnlÃ¹), or "Four circuits of rivers", which is
itself abbreviated from "å·å³¡åè·¯" (ChuÄnxiÃ¡ SÃ¬lÃ¹), or "Four circuits of rivers and
gorges", named after the division of the existing circuit into four during the
Northern Song Dynasty.
[http://www.people.com.cn/GB/shenghuo/1090/2435218.html Origin of the Names of
China's Provinces], People's Daily Online. The capital is Chengdu, a key
economic centre of Western China.
